greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Regular triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of integer partitions of n with maximum origin-to-boundary graph-distance equal to k.
comment: The maximum origin-to-boundary graph-distance of an integer partition is one plus the maximum number of unit steps East or South in the Young diagram that can be followed, starting from the upper-left square, to reach a boundary square in the lower-right quadrant. It is also the side-length of the minimum triangular partition containing the diagram.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Graph Distance
xref: Row sums are A000041. Column sums are A071724.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 11 2019
